theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Reprogramming and Plasticity Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on aging as an epigenetic state reversible by reprogramming, emphasizing plasticity and resetting of epigenetic marks.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Circadian and Cognitive Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on epigenetic alterations disrupting circadian rhythms and cognitive decline, linking epigenetics to neural aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transcription Factor-Mediated Epigenetic Memory Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights transcriptional memory via dFOXO activation and chromatin remodeling as a mechanism programming aging outcomes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Pacemaker Non-Linear Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models epigenetic aging as a non-linear, time-dependent biological age with coordinated methylation rate changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation and Environmental Modulation Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes systemic epigenetic changes driving aging and their modulation by environmental factors like diet and toxins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Stem Cell Division Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on methylation accumulation as a molecular clock reflecting stem cell division history and mitotic age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation Maintenance and Rejuvenation Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on DNMT1's role in maintaining methylation patterns and how modulating it can restore youthful epigenetic states.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Causality-Enriched DNA Methylation Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Distinguishes causal damaging and adaptive methylation changes using Mendelian Randomization to refine epigenetic clocks.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thermodynamic Information Theory of DNA Methylation Aging Clock
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models DNA methylation changes as thermodynamic and information processes linking entropy to epigenetic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Biomarker Epigenetic Age Acceleration Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic age as a biomarker influenced by genetic variants and distinguishing intrinsic vs extrinsic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Latent DNA Methylation Signature Aging and Reprogramming Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Identifies distinct latent methylation signatures reflecting reversible and irreversible aging components.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell-Intrinsic Hematopoietic Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes epigenetic aging as an intrinsic cellular process minimally influenced by external environment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Instability and Information Loss Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging as epigenetic drift and loss of methylation information leading to instability and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Pacemaker Non-Linear Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shares core concepts with T001530 on non-linear epigenetic age modeling and coordinated methylation rate changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Alteration and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of epigenetic errors in stem cells causing functional decline and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionarily Conserved DNA Methylation Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights conserved epigenetic aging signatures across species and systemic organism-wide aging processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Pacemaker Non-Linear Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Also models epigenetic age as a universal logarithmic function of chronological age with coordinated site changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Pseudo-Programmed Developmental Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Views aging as a continuation of developmental epigenetic programs with reversible methylation changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SET Domain Histone Modification Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on histone modification regulators (SET domain proteins) maintaining chromatin stability and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock Rejuvenation and Small Molecule Intervention Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes reversibility of epigenetic aging and rejuvenation via small molecules and reprogramming factors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ATP-Dependent Chromatin Remodeler Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights role of ATP-dependent chromatin remodelers in epigenetic regulation of aging and age-related disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation-Driven Epigenetic Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links accumulation of somatic mutations with DNA methylation remodeling as a coupled aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ribosomal DNA Methylation Conserved Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on rDNA hypermethylation as a conserved, universal epigenetic clock across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Division Epigenetic Molecular Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes methylation accumulation at specific loci as a mitotic clock reflecting cell division history.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Multifactorial Epigenetic Clock and Aging Mechanisms Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates multiple epigenetic aging mechanisms and links to hallmarks of aging and mental health.
